Reviews.Title: “Finally a good service”
Reviews.Author: Eric C
Reviews.Content: During my stay at the Novotel la Rustica, Rome, I hai some problem cause the hotel is too far from the download and the shuttle bus was too small to bring all the people. That Where in the hotel thats mens that everyday was difficult to find a sit on it. Breakfast was nice but almost everyday we need to asi for food cause, thats to the Huge around of people in the hotel, the Buffet was always empty and the staff Where in tribale cause then Where so fews people word ing in comparison of the number of guest. The Rooms are nice and clean, and one nightclub i hai a donne in the hotel and the food was nice an server in a nice view. I thank to all the staff of the hotel especially to Matteo Who was very professional , kind and polite, And always patiente and avaliable to solve and problem and need i had.He have me also the best advice to go around Rome and to see all the best and the most important museum and historical places and good restaurant, thank a lot especially to him. Eric

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed review.”
Reviews.Author: uclabobby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It looks nice, the rooms are comfortable, it has a seasonal pool, etc. I would consider it like a Hyatt Place, in the US. However this hotel is only a good choice if you have your own vehicle and want to stay outside (15+ km) the city center. Otherwise, think about it very carefully! If you don't have your own vehicle, you need to know: 1) that their shuttle only runs seasonally 2) that there is a nearby train stop (La Rustica UIR) into town but that station does not have a place to purchase tickets. 3) that this train station is useless if you are checking out on a Sunday (the next train comes around 2:30pm) and 4) that to reach the train station you must walk for 10-15 minutes on a path that seemed treacherous, especially in the dark. As you exit the train station, you walk for several minutes on a sidewalk right alongside a highway with speeding cars. Then you get to a junction where you must cross the highway, but there is no crosswalk and cars come around the corner in both directions. We had to wait for several minutes; cars didn't stop for us. In the photo, note the damaged guardrail! Once you wait long enough for a car to stop for you, you then go down the road leading to the hotel, which doesn't have a sidewalk and is unlit for the second half. It is near high brush and there were a couple card parked off the road in the dark. Ultimately if you are agile and maybe a bit risky, it should be fine. But if you are not comfortable walking for that long, crossing a difficult road, and walking on a dark street, this is not for you. We checked out on Sunday and since their shuttle doesn't run in the winter and trains don't run until 2:30pm, we had to pay about 25 euros for a taxi to the nearest train station. I believe the hotel websites list the wifi has having a fee, but it did not. They use one of those "free hotspot" type sites.. It was called "guglielmo." We were given a card with a username and password to enter for 13 hours of wifi. We got those for both of our laptops, and though my wife's worked perfectly, mine worked very poorly (DNS errors....) but I guess that is due to my computer, and not the hotel's fault. You must note the cost of breakfast! We booked our room as a Hotwire hot rate. When we ere notified of the hotel, it listed the price per night, and amenities like pool, restaurant, etc. At check in, the man noted our room was pre-paid and told us the breakfast hours, which happened to vary each day we were there. So we ate breakfast each day. At checkout we were told our rate didn't include breakfast, and that breakfast is 14 euros (!!!) per person, per day. After I complained that 1) Hotwire didn't say the rate was without breakfast 2) we were told the times at checkin 3) the in-room hotel FAQ guide didn't mention a charge for breakfast and 4) there was no reference to a fee in the breakfast room, he thankfully removed the charges. The group next to us was complaining about the same thing, but the woman handling their checkout wasn't removing their charge. So be aware! And if you are a traveler without a car, don't bother. It really isn't worth the trouble!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - No problems”
Reviews.Author: paulpowell3540
Reviews.Content: Yes it is a distance from Rome however the hotel runs a cheap shuttle bus/coach several times each day into the centre of Rome. The rooms are bright and clean with a great bathroom by comparison: It IS in an area which seems to have been forgotten once started however risking the traffic and winding access road you can walk into the town of La Rustica where there are some shops (about 20 minutes) PROS; Clean and good value. Free internet access (one with a printer). CONS: Hotel caters for a lot of tourist coached which leave around 8am after they have gobbled up all the breakfast, this is not topped up after the coahes leave so if you want a good feed get in early

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a superb stay at the Novotel. Although it's outside the city, the daily shuttle bus was convenient; our only difficulty was on 1st November, when there was no midday (weekend type) service and no public transport either. The family room was small and the position of the wardrobe with hinged doors made it impossible to pass. As usual, in Noveotel, the room was overheated to a constant 26° and turning off the heating made no difference. The mosquitoes in the zone made it unwise to open the window, so we suffered extreme discomfort in the heat. Breakfast was excellent on our last morning, although the first two days were chaotic and food supplies severely limited. However, a verbal complaint to reception resulted in a courteous apology and a realistic reduction in the bill. The waitresses were polite and helpful, despite their problems. The kids enjoyed using the X-Box and Facebooking. All in all, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Autumnholiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week in Rustica with children 8&10years. Hotel was easy to find. We rent a car from Ciampino. With car to location ok however not central. Rooms were standard, clean. Breakfast ok. Children didn't try the pool, in the morning it wasn't warm enough and days we were away - swimming in the sea.... We recommend Rustica warmly! Nice and helpfull staff in the frontdesk.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible ! 3 Filipino Tourist Robbed at Dining area at 7 am”
Reviews.Author: Lulugayan
Reviews.Content: security is lax in this hotel so Asians beware! Why anybody could just go in and eat their breakfast buffet! Non guests can come in like bag Asian bag snatchers! They don't even have a DOORMAN! In other Novotel branches( PAris) the head waiter asks for a breakfast & dinner stub, no one is let in until one shows a food sib/ ticket given together w/ the hotel key upon check in Worse we think that this Asian bag snatcher is in cahoots with a Filipina waitress in this Sappy hotel named Marilou Muraga( or Buraga). When I asked her what are we to do regarding the bag snatching incident and she said, the police are coming at 9 am. Imagine, she should have referred my question to her supervisor instead of making such statements. The following day, she was not around( hmmm, suspicious) and the hotel did not even made a report of the bag snatching incident that day. No Police Carabinieri went to the hotel! I lost 3000 euros, my Philippine passport, 2 digital cameras and several jewelries, and my celfone When I asked the Hotel Manager, at first she was giving the run-around, trying to see if she can avoid service to my plight but later she accompanied me personally to the police cause I don't speak Italian . thank Goodness for Ms Maura Moty who looks like Susan Sarandon. But who needs to be agog w beauty when my bag was stolen! Very poor service and they don't even remind the guests to take care of their belongings!

Reviews.Title: “Remote, but good when you get there”
Reviews.Author: HectorFromBerne Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We rang the hotel from the railway station to find out how to get there. The information given was excellent - friendly and accurate. But the hotel is still a significant distance from the station, making it less than ideal for those using public transport and the signage is not good. The swimming pool was great - even in October. The restaurant was excellent - great choice of food and wine, some of the best we've had. But at a price, of course. Breakfast on our departure day was marred by a large group who hogged everything. So individual guests, like us, had little chance of getting anything to eat or drink. The staff tried hard but were over-taxed by the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but too far from Rome”
Reviews.Author: pollypolooch
Reviews.Content: A lot of airport hotels are still in fairly civilized places but this one is really in the middle of nowhere. You can't walk anyway and you are nowhere near any public transport. Although there is a shuttle into town it comes back so early that you would be obliged to eat in the (not very good) hotel restaurant.. Luckily we were there in January so we were able to find parking in Rome and drive in. Having said that the hotel itself was very nice and extremely clean and, as ever with Novotel, very good value for a family of 4. I would recommend it for an off season stay or airport stopover only. Although there is a swimming pool there is very little outdoor space and nowhere pleasant to sit outside during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: SugarloafView Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I'm a Accor Platinum card holder so thought I knew what to expect from a Novotel. The room was dirty with bits of debris from previous occupants on the floor and hadn't been dusted in weeks. Typical Novotel layout. The window had a sticker saying don't open or else you will be 'invaded' by Mosquitos and then opening instructions for the window beneath. We didn't open the window but still had to kill a couple of mosquitos in the room. We tried twice to have breakfast but eventually gave up as (we were told later) two tour groups were in the hotel. There were insufficient staff to clear and prepare the tables and also re-stock the breakfast bar. We were just using the hotel to break a journey from the south to the north of Italy and knew it had a remote location (ie you need a car/taxi to get to the Metro to get into Rome) I recommend the Accor chain but avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Decor and cleanliness was of average. Food was over priced and small portions. Dinner buffet was still not completely set up 1 hour after advertised start time. The food was cold, desert was still frozen. It looked more like leftovers. I ordered a drink from the bar and got something different. When I inquired as to why the drink was different than what I ordered, I was told they were out of some of the ingredients so they just made soemthing different without telling me, only after I asked. Staff were seen leaving the toilet without washing their hands.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Novotel La Rustica”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was nice. The issue is that both the website and the reception staff were not honest and upfront about the very high level of difficulty and cost to go to Rome. I not only consulted the website ahead of the trip but also called the hotel directly. I was led to beleive that it was an easy commute. We had tremendous difficulties and the transportation costs were outrageous. We also had problems with the hotel staff and taxis. As the hotel is so far away taxis charge from the time they leave. We were not given that information ahead of time. Taxis were called that cost 20+ euros just to come to us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Rome”
Reviews.Author: familyholsapril2010 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and pool, free parking at the side of the hotel. Good breakfasts 12 euro for Adults children are free. Easy to get into Rome, shuttle bus. We stayed with two young children. Pool was clean and had a life guard.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay as long as you don't want to be in downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dreamworld1200
Reviews.Content: Nice building with confortable rooms and friendly staff, free outside parking. You must keep in mind you are approx. 14 km (9 miles) away from downtown Rome. The hotel is organizing shuttles to the Termini train station area, at fixed hours, cost € 3.00 per trip, per person, which is far cheaper than a taxi (approx. € 25.00). One bad point is the WIFI available only in the lobby and not in the rooms as most of Novotels do propose. It's free and working quite well. The breakfast as usual is wonderful but you should avoid timing when groups of Japanese (or any other groups) are just showing up and do pick up so much food that the hotel staff can't follow up refilling everything. International TV channels available, cofee/tea facilities in the room, nice (though a bit small) swimming pool. All in all, it was a nice stay and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TomasoAce
Reviews.Content: The Novotel in Rome is an excellent modern hotel. Everything is perfect and well kept, the room are very comfortable with big bed, wifi free signal and are always cleaned. Breakfast is fantastic, the buffet is composed by a lot of cold and hot foods: fantastic breads ,cereals, fresh fruits, eggs and everything is needed to start your day. At he Novotel in Rome the staff is very helpful, kind and skilled. They are able to solve all yours problems in a very professional way. The restaurant is very nice and the food always well presented is excellent. The hotel has a fitness room equipped with modern devices, perfect for relax your self at the end of a busy day. I had a wonderful experience at Novotel in Rome! I recommend this hotel for both vacancies and business trip

Reviews.Title: “OK for biz trip if with cars”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok and clean. But the breakfast is not worthing 12 dollars. Only scramble eggs, bacon, sausage, some bread, yogurt and oatmeal. Even the juice is diluted. Location is quite far from the station Termini, but fairly ok on the price. The pool is quite OK with 15~20m in length.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Zebra50
Reviews.Content: We had 2 days in Rome in Novotel. It is quite good hotel, it does not have something special, but it has everithing for comfort stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value ,Clean, good service, but nothing around the hotel”
Reviews.Author: wescbr
Reviews.Content: We took the train of FR2 from the Rome airport (FCO) to La Rustica for $8.00 per person ( Leonardo Express is $12 to Termini only). We checked Google Earth and it appeared that people can go through an industrial office building to access the hotel, however it is not accessible through the building complex. Therefore the only way to access the hotel will be a narrow road which you have to watch out for traffic. The hotel is in the La Rustica area which is very close to the Train Station -La Rustica U.I.R. however it is not accessible directly from the train station.Also, there is no grocery or convenient store around. The food menu is pretty standard but the breakfast is worth trying. Clean room, quiet location, friendly staff. The biggest bonus of this hotel is that they offer $6.00 round trip shuttle from /to Rome Termini every day until 8:30 pm. However if you are arriving from the airport you should confirm with the hotel for pick up/drop off location and schedule first. The Metro station "La Rustica" is currently under construction which should start the service in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for car travelers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for visiting Rome and it's surroundings with car. There is a plenty of free parking space. Rebibbia metro station is only a few minutes car drive away, where you can park for 1,5 EUR/day. Metro takes less than 15 minutes from Rebibbia to Termini (1 EUR/fare). Rooms are covered with free WiFi signal, but during our visit there was a problem with connection stability. Brekfeats is Novotel standard, staff is very helpful and friendly. The hotel offer shuttle bus to Termini station and back for 4 EUR/person but we never use it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, but quite a distance from central Rome”
Reviews.Author: rometraveller186402
Reviews.Content: Novotel, La Rustica, is a nice, clean hotel but it is NOT located in central Rome. To travel into Rome, first, you will have a 10 - 15 minute walk from the hotel to La Rustica UIR station. Then you take the train to Tiburtina, approx 20-25 minute journey. From there you can access the underground. To travel into Termini station (main railway/tube staion in Rome) will take you a further 10 minutes (approx) on the Metro. Note, that the hotel is located just off a main highway and there are not any shops/restaurants around it. Breakfast at the hotel was good, if somewhat of a bun fight!!! Croissants, orange juice bread etc is gone as quickly as it is brought out, so get in fast!. They also seem to run out of plates and dishes very quickly!! Nice, comfortable room and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - remote location”
Reviews.Author: Karla020
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because we know that the rooms have 2 double beds and the breakfast is very nice. Everyday we used the hotel shuttle to bring us into Rome centre. The shuttle stops at the termini - it leaves at 9am and returns at 8.30 pm for 4 euro pp. It's a good alternative if you do not want to spend a lot af money on very expensive hotel rooms. The rooms ar very quiet and you have a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A standard type Novotel hotel. It is a bit out of the way and not easy to get to but, it is very good for me as it is close to where I was working with my customers on Via Tiburtina. Staff very helpful, good buffet breakfast, tea/coffee in the room and lots of free English channels on the TV. Room, bathroom all very clean and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Far from city center”
Reviews.Author: muetzkugel
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. The hotel looked good at first sight, the rooms were ok, although nothing special. The breakfast was ok too. The pool area was no use. It opened late, closed early and while swimming, you watch the people sitting in the hotel restaurant. The fitnessroom was small and dusty. It took us quite a long time to get to the city center (15 minutes walk to the station and 45 minutes train ride). To sum it up, it wasn't a very bad experience, but not a good one either.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideally placed for a 4km drive to the Rebibbia Metro station, then a quick underground train journey into Rome that costs only 1 Euro! If you don't have a car, you can walk to the overground railway station nearby. A modern, airy and clean hotel. Excellent room, loads of space in a family room for four of us. Excellent and varied breakfast. Restaurant is good value compared with prices in Rome itself. Food very nice and well presented. All staff friendly and helpful. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: Bonigala
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel as other Novatel hotels but it is quite far from city centre. Took us 40mins from the railway station to the hotel and cost 70 Euros. Another 70 Euros back the station next day! No place to eat near the hotel. Nearest mall would cost you 15 Euros by cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel out of Rome”
Reviews.Author: lyam888
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel a lot of rooms but everything looks good and renewed. Restaurant has the same carte as in other Novotel, but food was nice. Well positionned to avoid all the traffic in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room and the bath room were pretty dirty, which is unusual for Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkie30
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights as was working close by. Room was fine, clean and had all amenties. Disappointed with the restaurant both the menu choices and prices. There is no where else close by to eat. Ate there the first evening but food was not great. 2nd evening took the train to centre of Rome and got much nicer food for a lot cheaper. 3rd evening was back last and decided to eat at the bar area, we were waiting for 45 mins after I asked if we could order food. Barman took the order and most of the food came , my collegue ordered a pizza and it had been reheated. Not what we would have expected at this class of hotel. Also the wifi is only available in the reception /bar area, very poor service for a hotel that seems to be full of Business guests. No english channels on the TV.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: weescotsguy66
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was ideal, it was a midway point between the wedding venue and Rome for tourist events. We had a car but it is easily accesible to the metro nearby although it is small walk but there is a bus service which we never had to use. Inside the hotel is what you come to expect of a business hotel, very clean and well kept, downside was the selection and prices of the meals obiviously with the endless pockets of the business man prices were slightly higher. Pool looked nice but we never used it, and neither did anyone else in our week long stay. Rooms very cleaned well as you would expect from a buniess hotel. price was fair and the beds are great.

Reviews.Title: “Too far out, food choice is poor”
Reviews.Author: joylene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in June 2009, the hotel itself is acceptable good rooms and facillities are OK. But the major down fall is that it is way out of town in a paddock in the middle of the commercial zone. They provide a shuttle for a minimal cost but it does not run frequently and the last one leaves the city at 8.30pm. A taxi fare was quite expensive at least 40-50 euros. What we found the problem was that if you caught the shuttle into Rome during the day, you either had to come back late after dinner, so you had to eat dinner in the same clothes you have been all day , or catch the shuttle back late afternoon after your sight seeing and then you are trapped into eating at their resturant, as there is nothing else around. The food was not to our taste, very bland and often they didnt have what was on the menu. The staff try to be helpful but the communication is very bad, the hotel seems to attract bus loads of tour groups and all the mornings we were there, the buffet was cleaned out before we got there at 7.30 am. Over all we wish we had stayed in the city and would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I won't recommend this hotel to anyone...”
Reviews.Author: fivetenfive
Reviews.Content: my review is going to be very simple: Location: bad bad bad and bad. the only entry to the hotel is through a highway??? you can't even access it by walking after getting off a train..? Food in the restaurant: Not tasty and expensive. We tried the menu of the day, which was 27 euros per person...and they fed us food like steaks in cubes and cold tomato pastas.... Great! wonderful meal it was (not!) Service: Definitely there's room for improvement as they never look into your eyes when talking. Yes, they speak ok English, so? what kind of customer service was that? Shuttle: Limited choices for time. 2030 is the latest time for pickup at the Termini??? Have they thought of providing a shuttle bus directly from FCO?? THAT WOULD HELP! Room: The only compliment I can provide is regarding the cleanliness of the room. Also, there's CNN and BBC as for English channels. That's all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you're driving”
Reviews.Author: HisFussiness
Reviews.Content: I like Novotels and this is no exception. I chose it as I was arriving late into Ciampino airport and this was a 15-odd minute anti-clockwise drive around the ring road. Oh, and I was too terrified of the reputation of Italian drivers (unjustifed I should now add) to consider driving into Rome itself. The location could be considered bizarre ie in the middle of a field beside a light industrial estate at the end of a road that looks like it's going nowhere, but as I was heading off over the Apennines the next day it was perfect. It's clean, the buffet breakfast was extensive and the hotel has a pool, although I did not use it. The nicest touch of all was when I checked in and handed over my passport the observant receptionist said 'Happy Birthday'. And yes, it was my birthday but I had actually forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Buona qualità ma non in centro”
Reviews.Author: Justfordream
Reviews.Content: NOvotel La Rustica is a standard Novotel hotel, clean, comfortable, not expensive for a family with children under 16 years, the room price included breakfast (very good and plentiful) for the family. Near the hotel there is nothing, if you want to use the underground you have to go to the station of Rebibbia by car or you can use the Novotel shuttle to go to and to return from the centre of Rome. Quality/price is good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for families with 2 kids in parents room”
Reviews.Author: roarpett
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4 - kids 10 and 13) have spent a few holidays in Novotel hotels in both France and Germany before, and always come back to this chain of hotels for two simple reasons: 1) They offer the possibility of having two kids under 16 sleeping in the parents bedroom, which makes the whole stay cheaper and simpler as we don't have to book two rooms. 2) The comfort and service is very good, and the hotels are good for businesstravelers as well as holidaymakers. The Novotel La Rustica hotel in Rome is situated just outside the ring road, and to bring guests to and from the center they have a free shuttle service to the Termini station. This worked like a charm for us, every day we had breakfast at the hotel before leaving for the city with the 10:30 shuttle. (there's also one in the morning at 8 am, but we're never up that early during our holidays) The return shuttle is at 18:30 or 20:30. The shuttle worked great for us, as we were there to see the sights of Rome. I can imagine that for people wanting to see Rome by night, or return later than 20:30, the shuttle won't work that well, but for us that was not the case. The hotel in itself is normal Novotel standard, nice and clean, and with friendly and helpful staff who speak several languages - we tried both French and English - both worked very well :-) The hotel has a nice swimmingpool outdoors, though not very large, it's more than good enough for the kids, or for a refreshing swim during the day. Since the hotel is outside of the city center, it's quite calm and nice to sit outside in the evening. On going home, we asked at the reception how to get to Fiumicino airport, and they got us a car with a driver for 47 euros, who drove us all the way from the hotel to the airport. (that's only 3 euros more than we would have had to pay with the airport train) This was very nice and comfortable, and got us to the airport in time - even with a few trafficproblems on the way. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome who are planning to spend the days in the city, and the evenings at the hotel. If you're planning on nightlife or staying in town late, I do not know how well the public transports would work, or how much a taxi would cost. But this was never an issue to us, as we always used the shuttle. We'll definately return to this hotel if we go back to Rome one day.

Reviews.Title: “You were warned!”
Reviews.Author: MARKOSTELO
Reviews.Content: Novotel Roma La Rustica - hotel review Just came back from a conference that we had in Rome and we were all based in this hotel. I was on so many conferences worldwide and conference means lots of business and meetings and working environment. Not to mention that this was a conference with members ad CEO`s from more than 60 countries. People you communicate on a daily bases electronically and this is your only chance to meet them for real and discuss business.. What a terrible choice this hotel,was.. First things first. The hotel has nothing with Rome. Its 45 - 70 minutes from the transporting center in Rome. There is a shuttle bus but only one at 10-30 in the morning and 17:30 afternoon and 19:30 going to Rome. Last shuttle that takes you back to Rome is 20:30! Thats all... They do state every hour but they state a lots of things. After that its taxi that will ocst you 40 - 50Euros. Get a lots of money for taxi if you are tourist. I have been on lots of conferences and mostly they were high class and business oriented hotels with a business friendly atmosphere. I'm not taking my laptop on those trips anymore, because all hotels have business centers that will help you to download your files print and do everything else you need. Those people here have only ONE PC on internet and printer without a toner next to the electronic poker machine! And they charge you a Euro for a 3 minute !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You must register at the reception for using a god damn PC!!!! And they claim the organize good business conferences? Food. Its average, nothing special. Don't even think to stay for diner there... Pool. Yes, there is a pool but I would not recommend anyone to swim in that concrete hole on the suburbs of Rome. The hotel is in industrial complex. When you go to a conference you have a chance to meet and socialize with the people you work with. That's our only chance in a year! This is where hotel should help you with creating a friendly atmosphere to socialize with your colleagues. After all day work inside the hotel, (Rome is one hour drive from the hotel ) you expect that you can have some nice time at the hotel bar. Guess what!. You wont. There are two barmen's, that will starting to create "we are about to close the bar-atmosphere" since 21:30 . They are starting to fix things, slam and mess with the bottles wipe mirrors and windows and create stupid faces... Every single night the same scenario! They close the bar very dramatically. There are aluminum blinds that are closed at 11:45 and lights are off... Yes it should be open untill 0100... Forget that. The barman is telling you they will leave us to sit inside the bar so that we don't worry about that. ( And you own him a beer for that! ) This is how I ended up with CEO`s from other countries playing Foosball outside, near the pool after midnight and wondering what we are doing. Foosball is actually the only sport and leisure that you can have there. I tried to outsmart them by ordering from a room service and when I did that they asked me for what time coz are opening at 09:00 ??!!! Receptionist are acting like your ex-girlfriends. They have Polite - bitchy - smart ass attitude to everyone in the hotel. They will at the end finish their job. . And my god, this hotel is soo overpriced!!!! If you pick your self a hotel , don't make the same mistake my company did. This is their first mistake and after reading emails from my colleagues that were there with me for 7 days I decided to post this review. All those bad things will be forgiven when you visit Rome. Places that you must visit. Vatican - St Peter and Sistine Chapell. Get your self a pro - guide! 20euro per person. Its worth every euro! The Ancient Centre , The Coloseum, The Forum, The Capitoline, The Pantheon, Spanish steps - the shopping area. If you found this review you ll find all the info very fast. So you were warned. :) Novotel Roma La Rustica - Forget this place . And Im not a person that does this for fun. Im sending this to Hotel code : 3303 Address : Via Andrea Noale 291 00010 ROME ITALY Hotel manager : Mr Marco MIGLIACCIO Head Chef : Mr Pasquale PISCOPO

Reviews.Title: “Modern Novotel right beside Rome ring motorway”
Reviews.Author: redalligator
Reviews.Content: This is a recently built Novotel in a developing commercial district right beside the Rome ring motorway. The hotel itself is better than most Novotels. Very clean & modern, but still a typical part of this chain. The room decor was better than many, but the bathroom still retains that single-piece moulded bath designed for customers under five feet high. Good breakfast selection. Dinner also moderate/good if you stick to the sensibly priced options. Swimining pool small & overlooked from the restaurant. To be clear, unless you have a car, you are stranded here. There is a small bus which shuttles down to the main railway station but it only departs the hotel at roughly 1.5 - 2 hour intervals (08:00 & then 10:30 onwards in the morning; 20:30 latest departure from Rome). There is nothing around within walking distance. There is a small railway station close by but I have no idea of train times and some other reports suggest it might be 'dodgy' at night. Get advice from the hotel before relying on this means of transport. If you have a car it is a much better option. Free parking (altho' outside & unguarded) & minutes away from the motorway network. A good option if planning a tour to Tivoli or Ostia. Also not bad if you have the nerves to drive into the centre & park in the huge underground carpark beneath Villa Borghese (there is also another massive underground carpark near the Vatican). If you are looking for a real Roman holiday forget this place. It is a business hotel in a commercial zone near a motorway junction. However, if you have a car it's not such a bad option, altho' totally lacking in character. My best piece of advice is to be very careful of valuables if riding on the metro. My wallet was stolen by pickpockets who were attacking as a 'team'. Thanks to the transport police I got the wallet back intact, but I was extremely lucky.

Reviews.Title: “world cup weekend”
Reviews.Author: puddey
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families and the pool is great but it is in the middle of an industrial estate. If you dont have a car and are totally dependant on the shuttle bus you are back at the hotel at 8.30 every night and believe me there is nowhere to go.We arrived at ciampino in the evening and where charged 60 euros for our taxi, others only paid 40 so beware. We used the yellow tour bus and it was very good (13euros) but there is also a bus and boat tour which costs about the same. If visiting the vatican they have a very strict dress code no shorts or bare shoulders even when its 37 degrees.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: alibubba
Reviews.Content: We worried about being so far out of Rome, but this worked for us. The hotel is beautiful, including a pool, and play area. Rooms are large with beautiful baths and comfortable beds. The breakfast is super. Plenty for everyone. The only negative is that the last shuttle left Rome Termini at 8:30 to come back so you couldn't see Rome at night. With young children, you probably want to be back anyhow. If you want clean, large rooms with great amenities this is the place if you don't mind the shuttle ride. (Also, a large parking area if you drive to Rome)

Reviews.Title: “Great for Ciampino A'Port and City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Sir Peter
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel !!!! Novotel's never let us down. We travelled into Ciampino with Ryanair, cab fare of approx £30 gets you to Novotel La Rustica in 10/15 mins. Approach to Hotel (which is within Commercial area of Offices & Supermarket-100m away-useful with kids) is a bit messy but the roads are undergoing repairs throughout estate - don't be put off!It'll be finished soon. We reached hotel by Noon and Valentina and the gentlemen at check-in were brilliant,very efficient, and making a fuss of our girls with small gifts, and we were able to take the room immediately. This allowed us to hop on the next FREE SHUTTLE into the city at 12-30pm. The bus runs all day from 8-30am to 8-30pm, with fixed times of departure from both hotel & Termini Station, taking approx 20 mins e-way depending on traffic. We booked via ACCOR HOTELS web site and the big advantage with Novotel is 2 Kids allowed in Room, and will receive complimentary breakfast with 2 Adults. The room was very comfortable & modern with a lovely en-suite (bath & shower). TV included satellite with English Channels. Very nice. Breakfast is fantastic; buffet with hot / cold / numerous breads + pastries, cereals etc. over-looking outdoor pool area (only open in summer). We communicated with the hotel via e-mail prior to our stay with certain questions and they were pleased to respond back. Nothing was a problem. In Rome, we had 4 days: 2 days we used the open top "RED" buses (13Euro one day OR 20Euro for 2 days, kids under 5 free). It was very convenient because you can hop-on/hop-off at all the main sites, however the quality of the English commentary via headphones was very, very poor indeed. Everywhere is walkable from Termini. For the less energetic you can buy a 1 Euro ticket which lasts just over an hour from first activation. Kids seemed to ride FREE with Adults on Public Transport, which works very efficiently. GO TO ROME - IT IS FANTASTIC! Whatever you do, don't miss the Trevi fountain, Colasseum, and the Vatican is unbelievable. The greatest city we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Shelby1957
Reviews.Content: My Wife 11year old Daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights. Although it is about 30mins outside the centre of Rome this hotel was excellent. Free shuttle bus takes you to the city. The Reception staff are very freindly and helpful, The room was excellent, the breakfast was good but the best of all was the restaurant where the food was first class. While this hotel might not suite young couples it is first class for families and business trips

HotelInfo.Name: Novotel Roma La Rustica
HotelInfo.Address: Via Andrea Noale 291, 00010 Rome, Italy
